intro: Carvalhoa petiolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ctenanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in cymes, and it produces small, smooth berries as fruit. Carvalhoa petiolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
